summary: This bill, the Studying Mitigation And Reporting Transparently Act (SMART Act), mandates the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to conduct a comprehensive study on the effectiveness, cost savings, and strategic impact of FEMA-funded hazard mitigation activities across the United States. The study will assess how mitigation programs reduce disaster response costs, enhance community preparedness, improve insurance availability, support infrastructure continuity, and generate long-term savings. The Administrator must submit reports to Congress detailing findings, recommendations, and make the study results publicly available.
